intro:
I also post in [GNUSocial](https://quitter.se/kzimmermann)

P2P aficionado, Free Software lover and Free Culture hacker roaming the free network

Check out my [ZeroBlog](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GiJUPsfiS3LWCyZj5urW1Rt2q9WwRh4wB/) as well!

If anyone still uses this thiing, you can also try [my PGP key](https://pgp.mit.edu/pks/lookup?op=get&search=0x93E212F0770F2CC3)

post.body: So this is like a true completely decentralized social network? Neat!
Is there a way to follow this zite in our home, so that we can get "alerts" from replies, mentions, etc? Haven't figured this out yet

Is there any plan to implement a system of #tags or a similar feature? 

IMO the way Diaspora does it could be a great starting point since you can also follow the tags there besides the people, making it a behavior similar to groups and stuff. #justMy2cents
An idea for a Random Pseudonym generator: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GiJUPsfiS3LWCyZj5urW1Rt2q9WwRh4wB/?Post:18:Random+pseudonym+generator
ZeroMe gets more intereting each day, and sometimes, each *hour*

Heh, with #TorBrowser and FoxyProxy now I can access five different networks at the same time:

1. ZeroNet (definitely the most interesting!)
2. Tor
3. I2P (great for torrenting!)
4. IPFS (static, but good to put media or files)
5. Clearnet

Very useful and very easy to set up. I started with the instructions from [this post](http://secure.thetinhat.i2p/tutorials/darknets/i2p-browser-setup-guide.html) (I2P link) and then expanded it to include ZeroNet and IPFS as well.

I'm looking for console-based music players. I've seen `cmus` (which failed to load with some `/etc/decnet.conf` error) and `moc` (music on console).

`moc` seems to be a great application, since it has playlisting capabilities, built-in volume control and equalizer features, but one big turnoff is the *color scheme*. When I'm in a `tmux` session, all panes are black or manually dark-colored by me, and `moc`'s bright blue background, which seems reminiscent from midnight commander, though this one I can easily change, easily obfuscates the rest and annoys me. Does anyone know how to change this?

Also, I don't know if there are other console-based players out there, but I'm taking alternatives if anybody knows of any.

comment.body: Dude, this is *by far* the coolest thing EVER done on a peer-to-peer platform. Thank you so much!
@Talnicrom: yeaaah buddy! Only here we can have no middlemen at all!
Interesting proposal! We need more of these alternative protocols

Decentralized all the way. P2P is the only way that we can truly have no middlemen to either police (censorship) or depend on (site downtimes, government takedowns, etc). I never tried Twister (it never compiled here) but I don't see how it can be any better than ZeroNet now.
@GramsciCat: you can edit your post after it's sent ;)
@Jayofthezero: agreed, I think that not even the @ mentions would trigger anything. We have to make a habit of checking for updates regularly :(
Reminds me of when the Play zite went up first
Nice! I'm sure it's going to be a great opportunity to introduce a great platform for the community!
hehe how long until we start saying things like "You new ZeroNet kids have it easy! Back in my day we didn't..." ?

@Nofish: good observation! Though I don't think the user base would be a permanent problem (it grows daily, as more people discover the ZeroMe zite just like it happened to ZeroMail), the seeding/discovery issue could indeed be a hurdle. If it requires centralization for a solution, then perhaps it's better to leave it out...

> Follow your username mentions and comments on your posts in ZeroHello newsfeed

:)

Wow! Very nice. And it even links back to the Dent containing the #tag

Good job there!
@RiotPulv: it's an I2P link. Perhaps that's why?

> Now you can use markdown in comments

Could it be? *Oh yes it could!* `:D`
Great concept! But we definitely need to get more people seeding stuff
